item-1.question: Is vlook an AI video, image, and music generator?
item-1.answer: Yes. vlook is an AI video, image, and music generator that lets you create multimodal content from prompts.

item-2.question: How do I generate AI video, images, or music?
item-2.answer: Enter a prompt or add a reference, choose a model, and generate AI video, images, or music in one studio.

item-3.question: How fast is generation?
item-3.answer: Speed depends on the model and input complexity, but vlook.ai is built for fast previews and iteration.

item-4.question: What makes vlook a strong AI video generator?
item-4.answer: vlook unifies leading models, offers fast previews, and makes AI video generation simple to iterate and export.

item-5.question: Are my outputs unique?
item-5.answer: Yes. Outputs are generated from your inputs, making each result unique to your request.

item-6.question: Will my exports have watermarks?
item-6.answer: Free outputs may include watermarks. Upgrade to remove watermarks on eligible plans.

item-7.question: Can I use outputs commercially?
item-7.answer: Paid plans allow commercial use for ads, promos, and product demos.

item-8.question: Do you offer a free trial?
item-8.answer: Yes. Start with free trial credits and explore core models.

item-9.question: How do I manage my plan?
item-9.answer: Upgrade, downgrade, or cancel anytime from your billing settings.

item-10.question: What is the refund policy?
item-10.answer: Refunds are available for eligible purchases. Contact support@vlook.ai.

item-11.question: Need help or a custom request?
item-11.answer: Email support@vlook.ai and we will get back quickly.

hero.title: Nano Banana AI image generator
hero.subtitle: Nano Banana (Gemini 2.5 Flash Image) is an advanced AI model excelling in natural language-driven image generation and editing. It delivers crisp composition, believable materials, and smooth style transformations so teams ship visuals faster.
hero.cta: Generate or edit images in the live workspace below, then iterate with references before export.

studio.description: Switch between text-to-image and image-to-image, add up to 10 references, then set output format and image_size/aspect ratios before you generate. Use the same prompt to produce channel-ready sizes.

snapshot.description: Built for rapid creative cycles with consistent composition, brand-ready color, and export control for ads, social, and ecommerce. Keep campaigns aligned without heavy post-production.

faq.title: Nano Banana FAQ
faq.description: Answers about Nano Banana (Gemini 2.5 Flash Image) and usage, including formats, ratios, and consistency.

item-1.question: What is Nano Banana?
item-1.answer: Nano Banana is built for fast text-to-image and image editing, making it reliable for daily creative production.

item-2.question: Does Nano Banana support image-to-image?
item-2.answer: Yes. Use image-to-image with up to 10 references to steer edits, variations, and style continuity.

item-3.question: What output formats are available?
item-3.answer: PNG and JPEG outputs are supported for easy publishing across web, ads, and social.

item-4.question: Which image_size/aspect ratios can I choose?
item-4.answer: Pick image_size/aspect ratios like auto, 1:1, 9:16, 16:9, 3:4, 4:3, 3:2, 2:3, 5:4, 4:5, or 21:9 to match each placement.

item-5.question: Can I keep brand style consistent?
item-5.answer: Yes. Multi-image references and prompt controls keep style, lighting, and palette aligned across sets.

cta.title: Create on-brand visuals with Nano Banana
cta.description: Generate campaign-ready images with text-to-image, image-to-image, and fast image editing in VLook.ai Studio, then export assets ready to publish.

examples.title: Nano Banana image-to-image examples
examples.subtitle: Real multi-image reference edits and final outputs for marketing-ready results

item-1.title: Editorial portrait relight
item-1.description: Two inputs guide lighting and styling; Nano Banana blends references into a clean editorial upgrade that stays on-brand.
item-1.prompt: Edit the portrait to match the lighting and style references while keeping facial identity.

item-2.title: Dual-style character remix
item-2.description: Combine two reference faces to create a cohesive, stylized output with balanced lighting and consistent tone.
item-2.prompt: Blend the two reference images into a single cohesive portrait with consistent color grading.

item-1.question: What is GPT-Image-1.5?
item-1.answer: GPT-Image-1.5 is an OpenAI image model for text-to-image and image-to-image generation.

item-2.question: Does it support image-to-image?
item-2.answer: Yes. Upload reference images to guide edits and variations.

item-3.question: What formats can I export?
item-3.answer: PNG and JPEG outputs are supported.

item-4.question: Can I control size and aspect ratio?
item-4.answer: Yes. Choose the output format and size before generating.

item-5.question: Is it suitable for professional design work?
item-5.answer: Yes. It is optimized for reliable edits, readable text, and production-ready visuals.

examples.promptSubtitle: Instruction following, text rendering, and quality upgrades

item-1.title: Combine subjects
item-1.description: Merge multiple references into a single 2000s film camera snapshot.
item-1.prompt: Combine the two men and the dog in a 2000s film camera-style photo of them looking bored at a kids birthday party.

item-2.title: Vintage soda ad
item-2.description: Turn a portrait into a period-accurate soda advertisement.
item-2.prompt: Create a vintage soda ad for a new drink called 'SOTA' (a new soda) with the attached man's face. The slogan is: nothing artificial about it. Make it true to the times.

item-3.title: Classic painting
item-3.description: Place the subject into a famous portrait composition.
item-3.prompt: Put me in the girl with the pearl earring painting

item-4.title: 6x6 grid
item-4.description: A dense grid with 36 unique items, icons, and labels.
item-4.prompt:
Make a 6 (columns) by 6 (rows) grid grid of:

Row 1: the Greek letter beta, a beach ball, a lemon, a robot, a fish tank, a frog

Row 2: a praying mantis, an expensive watch, a baththub, a pair of sunglasses, a colorful butterfly, an envelope

Row 3: a stamp, a picture frame, a steaming dumpling, the word "miracle", a pair of skis, the letter Z

Row 4: a toilet, a subway token, a mute icon, a bottle of perfume, a dragonfly, a skateboard helmet

Row 5: a Bluetooth icon, the number 13, a green heart, a rubik's cube, a Canada goose, a soldier's helmet

Row 6: a white dog, a life jacket, a knot, a keyboard, a tissue box, the number 14

item-5.title: Fibonacci infographic
item-5.description: Code, math, and layout rendered with precise typography.
item-5.prompt:
How does the Fibonacci sequence work? Explain it using both math and code.

Place a simple mathematical definition and short explanation at the center of the image. Around the central math explanation, show four boxed Python implementations of the Fibonacci sequence, using different approaches or styles. Prefer Python solutions that rely on standard python library abstractions.

Each implementation should be rendered inside a rounded-rectangle card with a subtle drop shadow and should contain, in order:

- a clear title at the top
- a code box with a light gray background showing the Python implementation (with correct Python indentation)
- a short textual explanation
- bullet points labeled “- pros:” and “- cons:”

Draw clear arrows pointing from the central math explanation to each implementation card. Keep the layout clean and visually structured, using a modern, professional infographic style. Use a pure white background, a neutral base color palette, and give each implementation card a distinct accent color, with clear spacing throughout.

item-6.title: Markdown newspaper
item-6.description: Preserve markdown formatting in a tall newspaper layout.
item-6.prompt:
There is a newspaper on a desk. The newspaper shows the markdown below laid out as a **natural** newspaper article. Preserve all content, formatting, and numbers exactly. The image should be tall.

# Introducing GPT‑5.2

### *The most advanced frontier model for professional work and long-running agents*

**December 11, 2025**

---

We are introducing **GPT‑5.2**, the most capable model series yet for professional knowledge work.

Already, the average ChatGPT Enterprise user says AI saves them 40–60 minutes a day, and heavy users say it saves them more than 10 hours a week. We designed GPT‑5.2 to unlock even more economic value for people; it’s better at creating spreadsheets, building presentations, writing code, perceiving images, understanding long contexts, using tools, and handling complex, multi-step projects.

GPT‑5.2 sets a new state of the art across many benchmarks, including GDPval, where it outperforms industry professionals at well-specified knowledge work tasks spanning 44 occupations.

---

## Benchmark highlights

| Benchmark | Domain | GPT‑5.2 Thinking | GPT‑5.1 Thinking |

|---|---|---:|---:|

| GDPval (wins or ties) | Knowledge work tasks | **70.9%** | 38.8% (GPT‑5) |

| SWE-Bench Pro (public) | Software engineering | **55.6%** | 50.8% |

| SWE-bench Verified | Software engineering | **80.0%** | 76.3% |

| GPQA Diamond (no tools) | Science questions | **92.4%** | 88.1% |

| CharXiv Reasoning (w/ Python) | Scientific figure questions | **88.7%** | 80.3% |

| AIME 2025 (no tools) | Competition math | **100.0%** | 94.0% |

| FrontierMath (Tier 1–3) | Advanced mathematics | **40.3%** | 31.0% |

| FrontierMath (Tier 4) | Advanced mathematics | **14.6%** | 12.5% |

| ARC-AGI-1 (Verified) | Abstract reasoning | **86.2%** | 72.8% |

| ARC-AGI-2 (Verified) | Abstract reasoning | **52.9%** | 17.6% |

---

Notion, Box, Shopify, Harvey, and Zoom observed that GPT‑5.2 demonstrates state-of-the-art long-horizon reasoning and tool-calling performance. Databricks, Hex, and Triple Whale found GPT‑5.2 to be exceptional at agentic data science and document analysis tasks. Cognition, Warp, Charlie Labs, JetBrains, and Augment Code report that GPT‑5.2 delivers state-of-the-art agentic coding performance, with measurable improvements in areas such as interactive coding, code reviews, and bug finding.

In ChatGPT, GPT‑5.2 Instant, Thinking, and Pro will begin rolling out today, starting with paid plans. In the API, they are available now to all developers.

Overall, GPT‑5.2 brings significant improvements in general intelligence, long-context understanding, agentic tool-calling, and vision—making it better at executing complex, real-world tasks end-to-end than any previous model.

item-7.title: 1970s London scene
item-7.description: Crowded street scene with clear faces and readable ad copy.
item-7.prompt: make a scene in chelsea, london in the 1970s, photorealistic, everything in focus, with tons of people, and a bus with an advertisement for "ImageGen 1.5" with the OpenAI logo and subtitle "Create what you  imagine". Hyper-realistic amateur photography, iPhone snapshot quality…

item-8.title: Flash glare photo
item-8.description: Printed retro photo with glare, border, and subtle rotation.
item-8.prompt: Generate an image of a printed retro photo of a young asian man and a young white man in santa hats at a bar, one of them is holding a drink. There should be camera flashlight glare visible on the printed photo. The printed photo should also have a thin white border visible, and should be slightly rotated

item-1.title: Audio-visual sync
item-1.description: Visual motion and sound rhythms stay tightly aligned. Speech pacing, ambience, and on-screen actions move in lockstep, avoiding the common “separate audio and visuals” feeling.

item-2.title: Audio quality & layers
item-2.description: Upgraded sound generation supports voices, SFX, and ambience with cleaner audio, richer layers, and a mix that feels closer to real-world production.

item-3.title: Semantic understanding
item-3.description: Stronger comprehension of detailed prompts, spoken language, and multi-scene storylines helps capture intent and produce more coherent, logical audio-visual results.

item-1.title: Cozy living room confession
item-1.description: A spoken line with soft delivery in a warm, intimate scene.
item-1.prompt: A young asian woman, casually dressed, sitting on a sofa in a cozy living room, softly saying: “I have a secret, Kling 2.6 is coming.”

item-2.title: Podcast dialogue switch
item-2.description: A two-speaker conversation with natural turn-taking and shared laughter.
item-2.prompt: A woman and a man are having a podcast conversation. The woman speaks first, then pauses. The man continues speaking. The woman says, "Why do you always work overtime until late at night?" At this point, the speaker switches. The man smiles and replies, "Because I make decisions during the day, and I'm responsible for changing those decisions at night." Both of them start clapping and laughing together.
